word:
We were pleased to learn a train left about 10:00 p.m. My berth had been procured, and I had the privilege of resting in my berth. When we reached Baltimore the car we were in was filled with an offensive oil smell, combined with heavy smoke. I was afraid the fire-box [axle] was on fire and that this caused the smoke. We tarried some time in Baltimore, and I tried to keep my 


                                  -26- 

breathing organs covered so as not to take into my lungs the oppressive atmosphere that was almost stifling.--Ms. 46, 1890, pp. 2-3 (Diary 16, p. 313).
